summary: William G. Miller is mentioned in several documents related to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC). He appears in a memorandum listing staff personnel with security clearances up to TOP SECRET. He is also present in transcripts of Senate Select Committee hearings discussing CIA activities, including the use of media and academics, and proposed restrictions on these activities. Additionally, he is mentioned in documents related to Project ZRRIFLE and liaison contacts between CIA's JMWAVE station and local police in Miami. Finally, he is mentioned in a document concerning Martin Luther King, Jr., and Stanley Levison's alleged ties to the Communist Party USA (CPUSA).
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: Based on the provided documents, William G. Miller's significance in the JFK context is not explicitly stated. However, his presence in documents related to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) suggests he was involved in investigations or activities related to intelligence matters during the time period covered by the documents. The documents do not provide enough information to determine the exact nature or extent of his involvement in the JFK assassination context.
